channel.title: Comments on: The world’s best breakfasts

item.title: By: Mesut
item.dc:creator: Mesut
item.description: Sarah, you should try open buffet breakfast in Istanbul next time. http://www.yakala.co/istanbul/istanbul-yeme-icme/istanbul-kahvalti-brunch-kategorisi
item.content:encoded: Sarah, you should try open buffet breakfast in Istanbul next time. http://www.yakala.co/istanbul/istanbul-yeme-icme/istanbul-kahvalti-brunch-kategorisi

item.title: By: Sarah Duff
item.dc:creator: Sarah Duff
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/the-worlds-best-breakfasts/#comment-379">Blair H</a>.
Hi Blair,
It's olive tapenade - delicious!
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Blair H.

Hi Blair,

It’s olive tapenade – delicious!

item.title: By: Blair H

item.description: OMW... Mediterranean food is the BESST! Whats the pate kind of looking stuff in the 1st image?
item.content:encoded:
OMW… Mediterranean food is the BESST!
Whats the pate kind of looking stuff in the 1st image?

item.title: By: Why Turkey should be on your bucket list | Getaway Travel Blog
item.dc:creator: Why Turkey should be on your bucket list | Getaway Travel Blog
item.description: [...] There wasn’t a bad meal to be found in Turkey – even for a vegetarian. I gorged myself on pistachio and rosewater Turkish delight, syrupy and buttery baklava, salty-cheese borek, hundreds of mezzes, from stuffed grape vine leaves and red peppers to olive-oil-soaked baked aubergines, salads with inventive dressings like pomegranate and walnut, sour, thick yoghurt with everything, the sweetest cherries and apricots I’ve ever tasted, and the world’s best breakfasts. [...]
item.content:encoded: […] There wasn’t a bad meal to be found in Turkey – even for a vegetarian. I gorged myself on pistachio and rosewater Turkish delight, syrupy and buttery baklava, salty-cheese borek, hundreds of mezzes, from stuffed grape vine leaves and red peppers to olive-oil-soaked baked aubergines, salads with inventive dressings like pomegranate and walnut, sour, thick yoghurt with everything, the sweetest cherries and apricots I’ve ever tasted, and the world’s best breakfasts. […]

item.title: By: Sarah Duff
item.dc:creator: Sarah Duff
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/the-worlds-best-breakfasts/#comment-376">Sid</a>.
Thanks Sid! Glad I could inspire you to head to Turkey one day - hope you love it as much as I did!
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Sid.

Thanks Sid! Glad I could inspire you to head to Turkey one day – hope you love it as much as I did!

item.title: By: Sid
item.dc:creator: Sid
item.description: Stunning photos. And your blog posts have definitely convinced me to visit Turkey one day.
item.content:encoded: Stunning photos. And your blog posts have definitely convinced me to visit Turkey one day.
